creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
description: Terra-cotta pipe with wood mouth piece; back of pipe has anthropomorphic figure with bull-like head; and around bottom are 3 animal heads with horns.
text: Elaborately decorated tobacco pipes of terra-cotta (baked clay), brass and wood were commonly used by men in all regions of Cameroon.  The decoration of the pipe was an indication of the ownerâ€™s rank in the social and political hierarchy of his community.
title: Pipe
